intro: Astrocaryum murumuru var. ciliatum, commonly known as the murumuru palm, is a species native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It is a medium-sized palm tree that typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters, characterized by its smooth, grayish trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces large, yellowish-white flowers and is known for its distinctive fruit, which contains a fatty seed used in the production of cosmetic and pharmaceutical products. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
